Citation_Information.description: Ross A. Beyer, Oleg Alexandrov, and Scott McMichael. (2017). NeoGeographyToolkit/StereoPipeline: Ames Stereo Pipeline 2.6.0. (Version v2.6.0). Zenodo. http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.581187

Service.name: NASA Ames Stereo Pipeline
Service.abstract_desc: ASP is a suite of free and open source stereogrammetry tools designed for processing stereo images and working with output terrain and orthoimages.
Service.description: The NASA Ames Stereo Pipeline (ASP) is a suite of free and open source automated geodesy and stereogrammetry tools designed for processing stereo images captured from satellites (around Earth and other planets), robotic rovers, aerial cameras, and historical images, with and without accurate camera pose information. It produces cartographic products, including digital elevation models (DEMs), ortho-projected images, 3D models, and bundle-adjusted networks of cameras. ASP's data products are suitable for science analysis, mission planning, and public outreach.
